comments.body: you should try deleting a namespace with O(100) events in it. We do this for every density test and it takes _soo_ long.

yup i noticed that.    great point !
I figured first i would start w/ just empty namespaces to verify that the cleanup is indeed happening ~ every minute.
Then we can add tests for dense namespaces and so on.
The deletion of a namespace with O(100) events should improve dramatically when we are ready to merge the following: https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/7372

For consistency, I'd prefer this to be in test/e2e/namespaces.go

$ ls -1 test/e2e
cadvisor.go
certs.go
density.go
docker_containers.go
downward_api.go
driver.go
empty_dir.go
es_cluster_logging.go
events.go
kubectl.go
kubelet.log
monitoring.go
networking.go
pd.go
pods.go
rc.go
scale.go
secrets.go
service.go
shell.go
ssh.go
util.go
